org.codeseed.common.config.ext

Class CommandLineHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codeseed.common.config.ext.CommandLineHelper

  • public class CommandLineHelper
extends Object
    A wrapper to help minimize boilerplate when dealing with command line arguments. Typical usage involves creating a resource bundle and associating configuration methods with the command line options: Given a configuration interface: 
     public interface MyConfig extends Configuration {
     @CommandLine("t")
     String test();
 }
    You should have the bundle com/example/config/messages.properties: 
     # Uncomment to change default values
 # syntaxPrefix=Usage\:
 # header=Options\:
 # footer=
 # help.description=show this help
 t.description=test value
    And you can construct a property source using the code: 
     public static void main(String[] args) {
     PropertySource cmd = CommandLineHelper.posix("com.example.config.messages")
             .withHelpOption()
             .withOptions(MyConfig.class)
             .parse(args);
 }
    Which would produce the following output when executed as test -h: 
     Usage: test [-h] [-t]
 Options:
 -h, --help  show this help
 -t          test value
    Author:
    Jeremy Gustie

      • withHelpOption

        public CommandLineHelper withHelpOption()
        Include a help option. Users will be able to use -h or --help to show help from the command line.

        If the bundle contains the key help.description, it's value will be used as the description, otherwise the default text "show this help" will be used.

        Returns:
        this helper

      • parse

        public PropertySource parse(String[] args)
        Returns a property source from the supplied command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments passed from the command line
        Returns:
        a property source backed by the parsed command line arguments

      • applicationName

        protected String applicationName()
        Attempts to determine the application name.
        Returns:
        the command used to invoke the application

      • syntaxPrefix

        protected String syntaxPrefix()
        Returns the syntax prefix. The default implementation looks up the syntaxPrefix message, if it fails the default value is "Usage: ".
        Returns:
        prefix to the usage syntax

      • header

        protected String header()
        Returns the header. The default implementation looks up the header message, if it fails the default value is "Options:".
        Returns:
        header to the command line options help text

      • footer

        protected String footer()
        Returns the footer. The default implementation looks up the footer message, if it fails the default value is "".
        Returns:
        footer to the command line options help text

      • helpExit

        protected PropertySource helpExit()
        Exit after showing the help. Technically this won't return because it just exits.
        Returns:
        nothing, won't happen

      • usageExit

        protected RuntimeException usageExit(Throwable t)
        Exit after showing the usage. Technically this won't return because it just exits.
        Parameters:
        t - ignored throwable that is making us exit
        Returns:
        nothing, won't happen
